decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [Unnumbered Cover Letter, A000, A001, A002, A002A A100, A210, A210.1, A310, Unnumbered Site Location Plan]Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - The access doorway to the [front] shall have: a minimum clear width of 900mm; a level surface or ramp between the pavement and the floor not exceeding a gradient of 1:12; a door handle set no more than one metre above ground level and a 400 mm high steel 'kick plate' suitable for the needs of wheelchair users or shall be automatic opening.  In cases where the door has no frame and is part of a fully glazed frontage, the door and glazed frontage hereby approved shall be clearly defined with visual manifestations on the glass at two levels: between 850mm to 1000mm and 1400mm to 1600mm above ground level. The manifestations shall be fixed to, painted on or etched into the glass in the form of a continuous or broken (by no more than 20 mm) horizontal band 50 mm high, or a series of signs or logos at least 150mm high spaced no further than 300 mm apart.  The manifestations shall visually contrast with their surroundings when viewed from both inside and outside the building in all lighting conditions.  Reason: In order to ensure that the development complies with inclusive design principles.
description: Installation of a  new shop front including relocation of  the entrance doors.
